resources.string:
Here are some of the rules fellas,


1. Team must travel on foot.

 2. Team must stay together.

 3. Team is not allowed to use Internet facilities for searching answers.

 4. Turn on the internet facilities.

 5. Do not move, tamper with, destroy or otherwise alter clue's answer location.

 6. Time Limit is 1 hour.

 7. Do not guess, Wrong Answer will result in a penalty of losing 1 min from the available time counter.

 8. Do not close the application in between the game.

• This event is divided into multiple rounds.

 • Each round has two questions,
 1. MCQ based Technical Question
 2. Location Question.

 • Only on the correct answer to the technical question, the location question for the round will appear.

 • For the location question, the team has to identify the location from the clues given in the question.

 • An answer to this question will be a four digit code which will be present at the location subtly defined in the question.

 • After giving the correct solution of given questions and solving series of clues, teams will move to next round.

OPTIMISTS is the student society of Association of Department of Computer Applications in JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida.
It supports students to cope with rapidly changing trends and technologies in IT world.
It provides students a platform to work as a team for learning, managing, training, organizing, enjoying and studying.

This event is coordinated by the students of MCA Department.

 Team Members: 

 1. Hemant Makhija (App Developer)
 2. Ojaswi Srivastava (Technical Head)
 3. Ankur Gupta (Co-ordinator)
 4. Mayank Garg (Co-ordinator)
 5. Deepak Chauhan (Co-ordinator)
 6. Manjeet Choudhary (Co-ordinator)
 7. Abhay Singh (Co-ordinator)
 8. Shashikant Singh (Co-ordinator)
 9. Sunny Shisodia (Co-ordinator)
 10. Sumit Singh (Sub Co-ordinator)
